*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*St. Louis*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-10-1826">Feb. 10th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir.—*/p*
*p*Permit me to introduce to your acquaintance the *person_mentioned*Bearer */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Mr. Geo. W. Heines*/person_mentioned* he goes to your *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* with views of settlement, he is a Gentleman of considerable interprise and great industry, such men you want in your *location_mentioned*new settlement*/location_mentioned*, 'tis therefore unnecessary for me to recommend him to your attention, he would be a valuable citizen in any *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*.—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. W C Carr*/person_mentioned* and your other friends here that are still alive are in good health, you have no doubt heard of the death of *person_mentioned*Mr. H. Austin*/person_mentioned* and his *person_mentioned*wife*/person_mentioned*, and *person_mentioned*Mrs. Richards*/person_mentioned*.—*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*St. Louis*/location_mentioned* is improving and our *location_mentioned*State*/location_mentioned* incresing in wealth and population.—I am glad to learn that you have succeeded in procuring the requisite number of *person_mentioned*Inhabitants */person_mentioned*to settle on your valuable *location_mentioned*Grant of Land*/location_mentioned*, I wish you long life and health to enjoy the fruits of your labours.—I should be glad to here from you when convenient, and tell me any thing you know of my old *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*Genl Wilkenson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W Christy*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Stephen Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* */div1*
